description: Marchay is a curated, membership-based travel service and community for some of the most sophisticated travelers on the market. Recognized by several leading publications as one of the premier luxury travel services, Marchay’s model provides a unique approach and complete solution to manage its members high-end travel needs. A key benefit to membership at Marchay is unbiased service by your own dedicated Senior Travel Advisor and team. Marchay provides unlimited, bespoke trip planning and execution, access to pre-vetted private homes and villas with additional amenities and preferred partner benefits at over 1, 200 hotels, globally. ***Although we are not actively hiring, we are always accepting resumes for both Luxury Travel Advisors and Senior Luxury Travel advisors. Please use this job posting to submit your resume for either position. ***Role Description: Travel AdvisorAs a Travel Advisor, you will work on a highly collaborative and fast-paced team led by a Senior Travel Advisor and alongside another Travel Advisor. You will execute trips for members from conception to completion, including trip research, correspondence with suppliers and concierges, booking of all details, and constant communication and collaboration with your team and your members. The ideal candidate is someone who has good industry experience –preferably in the luxury sector – is highly organized and detail-oriented, and is ready to collaborate on executing trips for members at the highest level. Please note that this is not an entry-level role and previous travel advisor experience is required. You will. .. Work on a team of advisors with an exceptional group of high-end travelers as your clients Collaborate with your team to research destinations, activities, dining experiences and more, customized to your members’ tastes and preferences Handle execution of all trip booking details from hotels to transfers to reservations and more Work directly with hotels, villa suppliers, DMCs and local fixers globally Collaborate with your team on research and recommendations for travel itineraries Tap your love for travel; provide targeted travel intelligence and advice tailored to each specific member's needs Be proactive and creative; seek out solutions off the books when needed Be an added voice in the conversation and accompanied projects surrounding Marchay’s growth and development as a company Role Description: Senior Travel AdvisorAs a Senior Travel Advisor, you will lead a team of Travel Advisors and must be exceptional in client relations and execution of various high-end travel arrangements, from building custom and highly-detailed itineraries to handling all systems and bookings. The ideal candidate is someone who has extensive industry experience – preferably in the luxury sector – can excel as the leader of a team, and is simultaneously a meticulous and fast-paced worker. Please note that this is not an entry-level role and significant previous travel advisor experience is required. You will. .. Lead a team of talented, passionate luxury travel advisors with an exceptional group of high-end travelers as your clients Maintain strong and highly personalized relationships with all of your members, in order to best plan their travels based on their tastes and preferences Spearhead your team’s research on destinations, activities, dining experiences, etc. Handle execution of all trip booking details from hotels to transfers to reservations and more Work directly with hotels, villa suppliers, DMCs and local fixers globally Build detailed and comprehensive travel itineraries Tap your love for travel; provide targeted travel intelligence and advice tailored to each specific member's needs Be proactive and creative; seek out solutions off the books when needed Be an added voice in the conversation and accompanied projects surrounding Marchay’s growth and development as a company

description: Who We AreEarthCam is the global leader in providing webcam content, technology and services. Founded in 1996, EarthCam provides live-streaming video, time-lapse construction cameras, and Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) for AI-powered visual asset management, leveraged through our intuitive Control Center 8 dashboard which integrates with leading project management software. EarthCam leads the industry with the highest resolution imagery available, to empower building information modelling (BIM) and Virtual Design Construction (VDC) teams with actionable visual data. EarthCam's innovations include the world’s first outdoor gigapixel panorama camera system, and the first ever 5G construction camera. EarthCam has documented over a trillion dollars of construction projects around the world. The company is headquartered on a 10-acre campus in northern New Jersey. We are seeking a detail-oriented and attentive Inventory Control Specialist to join our growing team. Responsibilities· Work with the Shipping Department to package and prepare orders for shipment· Prep, kit and deliver manufacturing orders to the Manufacturing Team for building· Work closely with the Shipping Management to create shipping labels and documents· Use MiSys Inventory Management system to create work orders for build· Prep and pack bulk items for future shipments· Receive incoming goods/orders from couriers and enter them into inventory systems. · Load finished orders onto delivery vehicles· Place/load inventory & raw materials onto shelves· Work with material handling equipment, ladders and stairs to access, move and stock inventory· Perform related duties as assigned by supervisor

company_description: Pickle is a rental marketplace. We seek to make fashion more affordable, sustainable, and accessible by enabling people to rent clothes directly from one another right in their local city. Our unique peer-to-peer model allows Pickle to have the coolest and freshest fashion out there. And our same-day local courier delivery not only allows our users to find a last minute outfit when they’re “in a Pickle”, but also helps people avoid fast fashion & shop sustainably!
company_locations: New York, New York, United States
description: Please apply by emailing alexandra@shoponpickle. com - see below for instructions on how to apply. We'll only be reviewing applications that follow the outlined process. Pickle is a rental marketplace. We seek to make fashion more affordable, sustainable, and accessible by enabling people to rent clothes directly from one another right in their city. Our unique peer-to-peer model allows Pickle to have the coolest and freshest fashion out there. And our same-day local courier delivery not only allows our users to find a last minute outfit when they’re “in a Pickle”, but also helps people avoid fast fashion & shop sustainably! Check out our app here and our Instagram here!Position Summary We’re excited to offer a dynamic and hands-on role for a creative and detail-oriented individual. You’ll get a unique chance to contribute to scaling our platform both in New York and across other early markets. You’ll work closely with our Director of Operations and Community Manager to drive awareness, conversion and retention of our user base. Hours: Full-time (9-5PM Monday-Friday). You can also anticipate additional hours (paid) to help support evening and weekend events. Salary: $22/hour + $200/month in Pickle credits!Key Responsibilities Events + ActivationsEvents are a critical aspect to our community growth, and a key element of your role will be supporting the prep and execution of a variety of events. Here’s what you’ll own: Create promotional materials in Canva for event invites + socials Set up event RSVPs on platforms like Partiful and Posh Source attendees through cold-outreach on social media channels, and create email blasts to invite community members Draft pre- and post-event outreach emails Collaborate with the NYC Community Manager on event execution, including: location sourcing, invite creation, set-up + tear-down; Engage with attendees on-site and post-activation Identify ways to amplify events through UGC, word-of-mouth and owned social media Email CreationWe engage with our community a lot via email, sharing inspo for what’s trending, educating users on what to upload now and inviting them to fun events. You’ll help create weekly emails to engage our users. Timely execution of these emails and high attention to detail is key here! Contribute ideas and source pieces to curate emails Manage the creation + execution of multiple emails / week Order Fulfillment & StylingWe’re an early stage startup and are big on interacting directly with our customers. If they’re looking for a rental, we want to make sure they get one! You’ll be a critical part of this: Monitoring order fulfillment rates and conducting outreach to anyone with order issues Provide styling help to people who are looking for a rental, but need some inspo Proactive outreach to our user-base to help them with rentals for special occasions (eg. birthdays) Influencer OutreachCreators love using Pickle, and we love introducing them to our platform! You’ll help us keep this initiative in motion: Conducting weekly outreach to potential influencer partners Help launch new influencer closets on Pickle, including sourcing, uploading and social content creation Ad Hoc Growth Initiatives *these will change based on need, but might include: Assisting with the creation of partnership pitch decks Conducting outreach to top users or top owners Learning Outcomes Being at an early-stage startup is fun! Things move quickly and we’re always testing and learning something new. That means you’ll be able to gain lots of exposure and hands-on experience, while you build your social media know-how and executional capabilities. …plus, you’ll get: Credits to try out our platform and rent the hottest items (!!) An opportunity to contribute directly to a platform that is changing the way people shop, while promoting sustainability and empowermenthere

company_description: SWK moves businesses beyond technology. We look at our client's whole business for opportunities to improve systems. We then apply our many years of business solutions knowledge and know-how to tie it all together… seamlessly. SWK offers ERP, EDI and WMS software products and solutions as well as customized software development and managed network services. We help companies that are well positioned for growth but are constrained by software, IT infrastructure, and workflow processes across departmental silos. We can help overcome these challenges. We understand that each of our clients are unique and technology solutions need to fit their individual workflows, not the other way around. This is what our team has a passion for, understanding how you operate then delivering solutions that will take you to new levels of efficiency and success.

company_description: We are FutureConnectors. Creators. Experience MakersFuture is a global multi-platform media company and leading digital publisher, with scalable brands and diversified revenue streams. We are dedicated to connecting over 300 million people worldwide with their passions, through expert content, world-class events and cutting-edge proprietary technology. We have big ambitions to transform media and change people’s lives. We have a market-leading portfolio of over 220 brands spanning across technology, gaming, TV & entertainment, women’s lifestyle, music, sport, creative and photography, home interest and B2B. You may have heard of us…But a stellar heritage isn’t enough. We continue to grow our portfolio and launch new brands, restlessly looking to improve, innovate and push the boundaries of what can be done. We develop leading-edge technology which is disrupting the media marketplace. Together, we’re exceeding the expectations of everyone we exist for – our audiences, clients, staff and shareholders. In a short space of time, Future has transformed into an innovative global media platform. We reap the rewards too, of course, with a fun and creative place to work with endless opportunities to forge a career. We believe in teamwork that transcends location, so we don’t have a Future HQ but a globally connected workforce across the UK, US, Europe and AustraliaEvery kind of talent is celebrated here. . We hire for person not for the role, looking for people who share our ambitions to be bold and innovate, making Future a global success story.
company_locations: New York, New York, United States
description: Are you a project management / client services expert in the digital media and branded content space who is passionate about delivering the best service and leading teams that do the same? Have you had success working with luxury fashion, jewelry &/or watch clients? Do you enjoy and excel at handling communication across all levels of a client’s organization? Do you have experience working with teams such as Sales, Video, Branded Content, Design/Creative, Edit, Ad Operations and Social to build programs from kick-off through campaign wrap? If so, we want to hear from you. Key Responsibilities: As a Director, Client Success at Future, you are the quarterback in the execution of some of our largest custom and integrated programs. Reporting to the VP US Client Success and Global Ad Operations, you are the client’s main contact after the sale, ensuring their expectations are met throughout the program and delivering white-glove service. You engage with all types of client stakeholders, from execution teams to senior decision makers. Internally, you are building timelines throughout the campaign and working with teams on production of custom offerings, ensuring launches, optimum performance and full delivery. An organized approach to project management will be imperative, balancing client needs and what our teams require to accomplish their respective deliverables. When things don’t progress as planned, you gracefully pivot and collaborate with clients and internal colleagues. You monitor performance throughout programs, recommending optimizations and upsells. Your greatest success is exceeding client expectations, having them renew a program incorporating your recommendations and getting to work with them again! You join a small group of other Directors, each managing teams of Client Success Managers, ensuring your team hits all their marks to do the same. Experience that will put you ahead of the curve. .. 6+ years experience in project management/account management, preferably in digital media Experience managing people / teams Excellent client service communication skills via email, presentation, and both virtual and in-person meetings Proficiency in CRM and project management tools such as Salesforce, Asana Experience working with luxury fashion, jewelry &/or watch clients is desired Experience in post-sale digital campaign execution Experience working with native content creation What's in it for youThe expected salary range for this role is $115, 000 - $135, 000This is a Hybrid role from our New York Office, working three days from the office, two from home… Plus more great benefits, which include; Uncapped leave, because we trust you to manage your workload and time When we hit our targets, enjoy a share of our profits with a bonus Refer a friend and get rewarded when they join Future Wellbeing support with access to our Colleague Assistant Programmes Opportunity to purchase shares in Future, with our Share Incentive Plan Internal job family level C4Who are we…We’re Future, the global leader in specialist media. With over 3, 000 employees working across 200+ media brands, Future is a prime destination for passionate people worldwide looking to consume trusted, expert content that educates and inspires action - both online and off - through our specialist websites, magazines, events, newsletters, podcasts and social spaces. We’ve got ambitious plans that further build on our growth momentum and unlock new opportunities – and we’re looking for driven people who want to be a part of it!Our Future, Our Responsibility - Inclusion and Diversity at FutureWe embrace and celebrate diversity, making it part of who we are. Different perspectives spark ideas, fuel creativity, and push us to innovate. That’s why we’re building a workplace where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to thrive. When it comes to hiring, we keep it fair and inclusive, welcoming talent from every walk of life. It’s not just about what you bring to the table — it’s about making sure the table has room for everyone. Because a diverse team isn’t just good for business. It’s the Future. Find out more about Our Future, Our Responsibility on our website. Please let us know if you need any reasonable adjustments made so we can give you the best experience!#LI-Hybrid

company_description: For more than 75 years, Miracle-Ear has been an industry leader, helping over 50 million people with hearing loss. We offer hearing products and services with a highly personalized and innovative approach, helping customers reconnect to the people and things they love through improved hearing healthcare. Headquartered in Minneapoils, Minnesota, we operate more than 1, 500 locally franchised and corporate-owned retail hearing aid clinics across the United States. The Miracle-Ear brand is owned by Amplifon, the global leader in the retail hearing aid industry, operating in 29 countries world-wide.
company_locations: Larchmont, New York, United States
description: Our franchise partner is looking for motivated individuals with a passion for helping others to contribute to the high level of customer satisfaction that Miracle-Ear is known for. Making a difference in people’s lives is why you chose this career. Our Hearing Care Professionals are industry experts, healthcare advisors, sales consultants, program marketers and product specialists all in one. As our team grows, we’ll invest in you by offering continuous training and development opportunities that empower our employees to become leaders in the industry. Responsibilities: Manage the customer journey through appointment consultation, testing, education, sale, and after-care. Offer personalized customer consultation on hearing solutions that fit their unique needs and lifestyle, while providing a comprehensive overview of hearing aid options. Lead sales of hearing aids and accessories contributing to individual and office revenue goals. Guide customers through device fitting and demonstration while educating them on the importance of hearing health and the long-term effects of hearing loss. Partner with the Front Office Associate to ensure a seamless customer experience, effective schedule management and clinic operations. Ensure data accuracy and privacy by maintaining customer records and ensuring compliance with all protected customer healthcare data. Stay current on industry trends and maintain professional credentials through continuous education and networking. Promote hearing health awareness through community outreach events and partnerships Drive local engagement by supporting marketing initiatives and managing special events. About us:For over 75 years, Miracle-Ear has led the way in innovation and customer service, helping over 50 million people with hearing loss. With 1, 500 franchised and corporately owned retail clinics across the United States, we’ve developed a deep understanding of how to care for customer needs and take pride in improving every customers quality of life. Through the Miracle-Ear Foundation, we give back to the local communities we serve, with a portion of every hearing aid sold helping someone in need. Fostering a culture of belonging allows us to deliver on our promise of helping millions of diverse customers rediscover all the emotions of sound. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If selected for an interview, please advise our Human Resources team if you require accommodation during the interview and assessment process and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

description: Our franchise partner is looking for a driven individual who is passionate about helping others to become our next Hearing Care Professional! We hire individuals from a variety of backgrounds and industries and help them grow from Sales Consultant in Training to Hearing Care Professional through a comprehensive paid training program and apprenticeship. No hearing healthcare experience is required. This is a rewarding, consultative, sales opportunity that has high earning potential, all while making a difference in people’s lives. Responsibilities: Manage the customer journey through appointment consultation, testing, education, sale, and after-care. Offer personalized customer consultation on hearing solutions that fit their unique needs and lifestyle, while providing a comprehensive overview of hearing aid options. Lead sales of hearing aids and accessories contributing to individual and office revenue goals. Ensure data accuracy and privacy by maintaining customer records and ensuring compliance with all protected customer healthcare data. About us:For 75 years Miracle-Ear has led the way in innovation and customer service, helping over 50 million people with hearing loss. We operate over 1, 500 franchised and corporately owned retail clinics across the United States and take pride in offering solutions that enhance our customer’s quality of life. At Miracle-Ear, you’ll experience the entrepreneurial spirit and camaraderie of a small business, with the extensive training and technology of an advanced corporation. We're invested in the growth of our people, offering continuous training and development opportunities to empower our employees to become leaders in the industry. Through the Miracle-Ear Foundation, we give back to the local communities we serve, with a portion of the cost of every hearing aid sold helping someone in need. Fostering a culture of belonging allows us to deliver on our promise of helping millions of diverse customers rediscover all the emotions of sound. Our corporate team is headquartered in Minneapolis, Minnesota, and our parent company, Amplifon, is the global leader in the retail hearing aid industry, operating in 26 countries world-wide. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If selected for an interview, please advise our Human Resources team if you require accommodation during the interview and assessment process and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

company_locations: Boonton, New Jersey, United States
description: About Us PTW North America Corporation, a leader in precision dosimetry solutions for the radiotherapy field, is looking for an experienced and driven Sales Representative to join our team. Our advanced hardware and software products are trusted by radiotherapy departments worldwide to ensure patient safety in cancer treatment. As a wholly owned subsidiary of PTW of Freiburg, Germany, with a proud history dating back to 1922, we continue to innovate and lead in radiation measurement technology. Position Overview This position serves the Central Territory, which includes Colorado, Kansas, Montana, Nebraska, New Mexico, North Dakota, Oklahoma, South Dakota, Texas, and Wyoming. Ideally, candidates will reside in Texas, however the prospective candidate may reside within the territory as long as they are close to a major airport. Key Responsibilities Drive sales of high-precision radiotherapy dosimetry hardware and software to Medical Physicists (primarily PhD and MS level) in radiotherapy departments at medical facilities. Cultivate strong customer relationships, maintain an active presence within the territory, and grow sales in a market with immense potential. Manage a sales cycle that ranges from one month to over two years, depending on project scope and client needs. Benefits Competitive base salary with structured, uncapped commission potential. Generous benefits package including medical, dental, and eye care coverage, along with a 401(k) with company matching. Flexible, home-based position requiring 50% travel. Ideal Candidate Qualifications Character: Demonstrated integrity, reliability, honesty, diligence, and a conscientious work ethic. Sales Experience: Proven background in capital medical equipment sales, ideally within radiotherapy dosimetry or related medical fields. Technical Expertise: Proficient in PC usage, Microsoft Office applications (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint), and CRM systems. Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Flexibility and Independence: Able to work independently from home and willing to travel within the territory. Our Team Joining PTW North America means joining a close-knit team of individuals who work collaboratively in a supportive small-business environment. We’re looking for someone who will contribute positively to our culture of teamwork, respect, and innovation. Interested? To apply, please send your resume to Joanna Sifonios, Office Manager, at Joanna. Sifonios@ptwdosimetry. com.

title: CRM Technical Developer

company_locations: New York, New York, United States
description: Position OverviewWe are excited to welcome a skilled Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM Developer to our dynamic team. In this role, you will play a crucial part in crafting, deploying, and maintaining cutting-edge CRM solutions that streamline business operations and foster growth. You will work collaboratively with various teams to design, analyze, build, and test CRM functionalities. Beyond development, you’ll also address system-related challenges, ensuring business goals are consistently met. Core ResponsibilitiesCRM Solution Development Build, customize, and implement Microsoft Dynamics CRM solutions while ensuring compatibility with existing systems. Create and manage workflows, dashboards, forms, and views, alongside developing both custom and standard reports. Develop web-based applications, APIs, console tools, and Windows services to support CRM functionality. Guarantee that all technical deliverables align with business needs and maintain high-quality standards. Project Coordination and Documentation Contribute to technical solution planning and project discussions. Prepare and maintain essential documentation, including source code details, technical designs, and testing outcomes. Support key project phases such as System Integration Testing (SIT) and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) by resolving issues efficiently. Enhancing Business Processes Identify business challenges and recommend creative CRM solutions to enhance efficiency and profitability. Stay informed on emerging tools, technologies, and best practices to continually improve solutions. QualificationsRequired Skills and Experience Deep knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM, particularly in Customer Service applications. A minimum of three years of hands-on experience with Dynamics 365 CRM and Power BI development. Strong programming skills in ASP. NET C#, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, and related web technologies. Additional Preferred Skills Previous experience in the shipping industry or similar sectors. Familiarity with Agile and SCRUM frameworks. What We’re Looking ForKey Soft Skills Passion for solving complex business problems through technology. Self-motivated and quick to adapt to new challenges or tools. Collaborative mindset, particularly when working with global or remote teams. Strong verbal and written communication skills in English. A proactive attitude and the ability to manage shifting priorities effectively. Personal CharacteristicsThe ideal candidate thrives in a team-oriented environment, adapts easily to changing requirements, and is dedicated to process improvement and automation. They are dependable, flexible, and eager to take on new learning opportunities. Why Join Us?If you’re passionate about leveraging your skills to create impactful CRM solutions in a fast-paced, supportive team, this role is for you. Apply today and take the next step in your career journey!

company_locations: East Brunswick, New Jersey, United States
description: Do you have experience in building maintenance, janitorial, or similar industries? Do you have strong management experience and good communication skills? Are you seeking a full-time evening shift position? If you answered yes, consider this great opportunity with City Wide!We are seeking a Night Manager to join our team! The Night Manager is responsible for assisting with management of contract compliance for designated building maintenance services, as well as maintaining the relationship between City Wide and Independent Contractors. Employee must possess the ability to review the client contract and check that work expectations have been met. This position would typically work from 3pm to 12am. Why City Wide?City Wide Facility Solutions is a leader in the building maintenance industry, with locations that serve communities across the U. S. and Canada. Our company mission is to create a ripple effect. ..by positively impacting the community of people we serve. Our vision is the be the first choice for our clients, contractors and employees . Our values of community, accountability and professionalism are how we model success. At City Wide, you will find a high-energy work environment that rewards performance within a collaborative, inclusive and fun environment. Are you ready to join?Essential Functions Develop and maintain productive, working relationships with Independent Contractors (IC) by communicating client priorities and collaborating on solving problems. Review scope of work and ensure quality assurance per account to retain existing business and gain new business. Communicate with Facility Services Manager daily for any issues that need immediate attention, including the nightly recap via email or phone message. Make recommendations for IC work assignments, manage to client standards and company guidelines, and discharge if not meeting service level agreement. Manage inspections, customer complaints, customer requests, new client starts, or VIP treatment needing attention. Execute City Wide’s New-Start Policy, Customer Compliant Policy, Four Star Policy, and other operational policies and procedures. Ensure compliance with client policies & procedures, approved cleaning tools and equipment and their proper use. Other duties as necessary.

description: ALMA1938 is a multi-faceted leather supplier and manufacturer based in Central London. We are seeking dynamic and driven Sales Agents throughout the US to identify sales opportunities for leather, flooring, wall covering and bespoke project sales. The ideal candidate will have contacts in interior design, flooring, wall covering and furniture manufacturers that they can tap into. Responsibilities Develop and maintain strong relationships with existing and potential customers. Identify customer needs and provide appropriate product recommendations. Collaborate with team members to achieve sales targets and enhance customer satisfaction. Conduct product presentations and demonstrations to showcase features and benefits. Manage the sales process from initial contact through to closing the deal. Maintain accurate records of customer interactions, sales activities, and pipeline status within the CRM. Stay informed about industry trends, market conditions, and competitor activities. Provide exceptional customer service by addressing inquiries and resolving issues promptly. Skills Strong customer service skills with a focus on building long-term relationships. Excellent collaboration skills, working effectively within a team environment to achieve common goals. Outstanding communication skills, both verbal and written, to convey information clearly and persuasively. Ability to adapt to changing circumstances and handle multiple priorities effectively. Proficient in using CRM software and other sales tools to manage customer information and track progress. A results-oriented mindset with a passion for achieving sales targets while maintaining high levels of customer satisfaction. Join us as we strive for excellence in sales while providing top-notch service to our customers!

company_description: Founded in 2009, Shift Markets began in the traditional finance world, as a leader in the FX space. Sensing the seismic shifts taking place in the financial industry, and the disruptive power of cryptocurrencies and blockchain, we made it our mission to make these decentralized trends accessible to every business, from market leaders to small retailers. Our transition into the crypto, blockchain, and Web 3. 0 space has centered on the development and deployment of seamless enterprise and Web 3. 0 solutions. By offering implementation and consultation services beyond our product range, we ensure that every business gets the Web 3. 0 solutions that fit their needs, and fit snugly within their existing tech stack.

description: Shift was founded in 2009 focused on the FX space. Sensing the seismic shifts taking place in the financial industry, and the disruptive power of digital assets, we made it our mission to make these decentralized trends accessible to every business, from market leaders to small retailers. As we continue to expand, we are looking for a Business Development Representative (BDR) to support our sales initiatives, drive lead generation, and build long-term client relationships. This is an exciting opportunity for a proactive and driven individual who thrives in a fast-paced, high-impact environment. The BDR will focus on identifying and engaging potential clients, optimizing outbound strategies, as well as developing and tracking key metrics. You will work closely with senior leadership and the marketing team to refine outreach strategies and optimize our sales funnel. Key Responsibilities: Develop and execute lead generation strategies to build a strong sales pipeline. Identify target accounts, decision-makers, and customer profiles within the crypto, fintech, and SaaS industries. Engage potential clients through cold calls, emails, LinkedIn outreach, and networking. Qualify leads and schedule meetings for senior sales representatives. Collaborate with the marketing team to optimize lead funnels and improve conversion rates. Utilize CRM (Zoho CRM) to track leads, manage sales activities, and report progress. Assist in refining the sales process and identifying new revenue opportunities. Track key sales metrics, goals, and OKRs to ensure performance benchmarks are met. Support partnership management efforts, fostering strong relationships with external stakeholders. Who You Are: Highly motivated, goal-driven, and results-oriented. 1-3 years of experience in business development, sales, or lead generation (Must be in fintech, SaaS, or crypto). Strong understanding of outbound sales techniques and prospecting tools. Excellent communication and relationship-building skills. Ability to work in a fast-paced startup environment and adapt to evolving priorities. Comfortable with international (2-3 times per year) and domestic travel as required Based in NYC and able to work in-office at least twice a week.

description: In our quest for innovation, we are seeking a truly exceptional individual to step into the role of the Energy Efficiency (C&I) Program Manager. As a valued member of our vibrant New Jersey team, you will embark on an exhilarating journey. Leading a dedicated squad of outreach, engineering, and operations experts, you will take charge of implementing expansive energy efficiency programs. Building trust is the linchpin of success in this position, as you form strong relationships with clients, industry stakeholders, and program contacts from various corners of the organization and beyond. Your mastery will be pivotal in spearheading C&I-specific endeavors across program implementation, covering outreach, engineering services, and project management initiatives. Resource Innovations (RI) is a women-led energy transformation firm focused on impact. Building on our expertise in energy efficiency, we're constantly expanding our portfolio of clean energy solutions to guide utilities through increasingly complex, connected challenges. Load flexibility. Electrification. Carbon reduction. With every step, we're leading the charge to power change. Duties and Responsibilities Manages and develops program design including the development of work plans to meet goals, aligning staff assignments, managing programs to goal and providing accurate forecasting both internally and to clients. Delivers successful large-budget energy efficiency programs to utility clients per contract terms and budgets. Identifies, defines, quantifies, tracks, and drives program deliverables to be submitted accurately and on time. Continuously assesses project progress to goal and develops innovative and creative solutions to new issues and/or market dynamics. Manages, leads, and mentors a dynamic team by setting and reviewing performance standards and objectives for direct reports and creates effective delivery teams. Analyzes market and contractor participation data, including geographic analysis and opportunity assessments. Develops, manages, and fosters partnerships with subcontractors, community groups, and other industry affiliates/stakeholders. Manages client expectations, satisfaction, communications, and resolves and/or escalates client issues. Interfaces with key internal departments such as IT, Marketing, Finance, and HR to develop efficiencies to meet program needs. Other duties as assigned.

description: Who We AreEarthCam is the global leader in providing webcam content, technology and services. Founded in 1996, EarthCam provides live-streaming video, time-lapse construction cameras, and Software-as-a-Service (SaaS) for AI-powered visual asset management, leveraged through our intuitive Control Center 8 dashboard which integrates with leading project management software. EarthCam leads the industry with the highest resolution imagery available, to empower building information modelling (BIM) and Virtual Design Construction (VDC) teams with actionable visual data. EarthCam's innovations include the world’s first outdoor gigapixel panorama camera system, and the first ever 5G construction camera. EarthCam has documented over a trillion dollars of construction projects around the world. The company is headquartered on a 10-acre campus in northern New Jersey. We are seeking a detail-oriented and attentive Inventory Control Specialist to join our growing team. Responsibilities· Work with the Shipping Department to package and prepare orders for shipment· Prep, kit and deliver manufacturing orders to the Manufacturing Team for building· Work closely with the Shipping Management to create shipping labels and documents· Use MiSys Inventory Management system to create work orders for build· Prep and pack bulk items for future shipments· Receive incoming goods/orders from couriers and enter them into inventory systems. · Load finished orders onto delivery vehicles· Place/load inventory & raw materials onto shelves· Work with material handling equipment, ladders and stairs to access, move and stock inventory· Perform related duties as assigned by supervisor

description: Please apply by emailing alexandra@shoponpickle. com - see below for instructions on how to apply. We'll only be reviewing applications that follow the outlined process. Pickle is a rental marketplace. We seek to make fashion more affordable, sustainable, and accessible by enabling people to rent clothes directly from one another right in their city. Our unique peer-to-peer model allows Pickle to have the coolest and freshest fashion out there. And our same-day local courier delivery not only allows our users to find a last minute outfit when they’re “in a Pickle”, but also helps people avoid fast fashion & shop sustainably! Check out our app here and our Instagram here!Position Summary We’re excited to offer a dynamic and hands-on role for a creative and detail-oriented individual. You’ll get a unique chance to contribute to scaling our platform both in New York and across other early markets. You’ll work closely with our Director of Operations and Community Manager to drive awareness, conversion and retention of our user base. Hours: Full-time (9-5PM Monday-Friday). Salary: $22/hour + $200/month in Pickle credits!Key Responsibilities Events + ActivationsEvents are a critical aspect to our community growth, and a key element of your role will be supporting the prep and execution of a variety of events. You’ll help create weekly emails to engage our users. Timely execution of these emails and high attention to detail is key here! Contribute ideas and source pieces to curate emails Manage the creation + execution of multiple emails / week Order Fulfillment & StylingWe’re an early stage startup and are big on interacting directly with our customers. If they’re looking for a rental, we want to make sure they get one! You’ll be a critical part of this: Monitoring order fulfillment rates and conducting outreach to anyone with order issues Provide styling help to people who are looking for a rental, but need some inspo Proactive outreach to our user-base to help them with rentals for special occasions (eg. birthdays) Influencer OutreachCreators love using Pickle, and we love introducing them to our platform! You’ll help us keep this initiative in motion: Conducting weekly outreach to potential influencer partners Help launch new influencer closets on Pickle, including sourcing, uploading and social content creation Ad Hoc Growth Initiatives *these will change based on need, but might include: Assisting with the creation of partnership pitch decks Conducting outreach to top users or top owners Learning Outcomes Being at an early-stage startup is fun! Things move quickly and we’re always testing and learning something new. That means you’ll be able to gain lots of exposure and hands-on experience, while you build your social media know-how and executional capabilities. …plus, you’ll get: Credits to try out our platform and rent the hottest items (!!) An opportunity to contribute directly to a platform that is changing the way people shop, while promoting sustainability and empowermenthere

company_description: We are FutureConnectors. Creators. Experience MakersFuture is a global multi-platform media company and leading digital publisher, with scalable brands and diversified revenue streams. We are dedicated to connecting over 300 million people worldwide with their passions, through expert content, world-class events and cutting-edge proprietary technology. We have big ambitions to transform media and change people’s lives. We have a market-leading portfolio of over 220 brands spanning across technology, gaming, TV & entertainment, women’s lifestyle, music, sport, creative and photography, home interest and B2B. You may have heard of us…But a stellar heritage isn’t enough. We continue to grow our portfolio and launch new brands, restlessly looking to improve, innovate and push the boundaries of what can be done. We develop leading-edge technology which is disrupting the media marketplace. Together, we’re exceeding the expectations of everyone we exist for – our audiences, clients, staff and shareholders. In a short space of time, Future has transformed into an innovative global media platform. We reap the rewards too, of course, with a fun and creative place to work with endless opportunities to forge a career. We believe in teamwork that transcends location, so we don’t have a Future HQ but a globally connected workforce across the UK, US, Europe and AustraliaEvery kind of talent is celebrated here. . We hire for person not for the role, looking for people who share our ambitions to be bold and innovate, making Future a global success story.

Reporting to the VP US Client Success and Global Ad Operations, you are the client’s main contact after the sale, ensuring their expectations are met throughout the program and delivering white-glove service. You engage with all types of client stakeholders, from execution teams to senior decision makers. Internally, you are building timelines throughout the campaign and working with teams on production of custom offerings, ensuring launches, optimum performance and full delivery. An organized approach to project management will be imperative, balancing client needs and what our teams require to accomplish their respective deliverables. When things don’t progress as planned, you gracefully pivot and collaborate with clients and internal colleagues. You monitor performance throughout programs, recommending optimizations and upsells. Your greatest success is exceeding client expectations, having them renew a program incorporating your recommendations and getting to work with them again! You join a small group of other Directors, each managing teams of Client Success Managers, ensuring your team hits all their marks to do the same. Experience that will put you ahead of the curve. .. 6+ years experience in project management/account management, preferably in digital media Experience managing people / teams Excellent client service communication skills via email, presentation, and both virtual and in-person meetings Proficiency in CRM and project management tools such as Salesforce, Asana Experience working with luxury fashion, jewelry &/or watch clients is desired Experience in post-sale digital campaign execution Experience working with native content creation What's in it for youThe expected salary range for this role is $115, 000 - $135, 000This is a Hybrid role from our New York Office, working three days from the office, two from home… Plus more great benefits, which include; Uncapped leave, because we trust you to manage your workload and time When we hit our targets, enjoy a share of our profits with a bonus Refer a friend and get rewarded when they join Future Wellbeing support with access to our Colleague Assistant Programmes Opportunity to purchase shares in Future, with our Share Incentive Plan Internal job family level C4Who are we…We’re Future, the global leader in specialist media. With over 3, 000 employees working across 200+ media brands, Future is a prime destination for passionate people worldwide looking to consume trusted, expert content that educates and inspires action - both online and off - through our specialist websites, magazines, events, newsletters, podcasts and social spaces. We’ve got ambitious plans that further build on our growth momentum and unlock new opportunities – and we’re looking for driven people who want to be a part of it!Our Future, Our Responsibility - Inclusion and Diversity at FutureWe embrace and celebrate diversity, making it part of who we are. Different perspectives spark ideas, fuel creativity, and push us to innovate. That’s why we’re building a workplace where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to thrive. When it comes to hiring, we keep it fair and inclusive, welcoming talent from every walk of life. It’s not just about what you bring to the table — it’s about making sure the table has room for everyone. Because a diverse team isn’t just good for business. It’s the Future. Find out more about Our Future, Our Responsibility on our website. Please let us know if you need any reasonable adjustments made so we can give you the best experience!#LI-Hybrid

company_description: We are FutureConnectors. Creators. Experience MakersFuture is a global multi-platform media company and leading digital publisher, with scalable brands and diversified revenue streams. We are dedicated to connecting over 300 million people worldwide with their passions, through expert content, world-class events and cutting-edge proprietary technology. We have big ambitions to transform media and change people’s lives. We have a market-leading portfolio of over 220 brands spanning across technology, gaming, TV & entertainment, women’s lifestyle, music, sport, creative and photography, home interest and B2B. You may have heard of us…But a stellar heritage isn’t enough. We continue to grow our portfolio and launch new brands, restlessly looking to improve, innovate and push the boundaries of what can be done. We develop leading-edge technology which is disrupting the media marketplace. Together, we’re exceeding the expectations of everyone we exist for – our audiences, clients, staff and shareholders. In a short space of time, Future has transformed into an innovative global media platform. We reap the rewards too, of course, with a fun and creative place to work with endless opportunities to forge a career. We believe in teamwork that transcends location, so we don’t have a Future HQ but a globally connected workforce across the UK, US, Europe and AustraliaEvery kind of talent is celebrated here. . We hire for person not for the role, looking for people who share our ambitions to be bold and innovate, making Future a global success story.

company_description: For more than 75 years, Miracle-Ear has been an industry leader, helping over 50 million people with hearing loss. We offer hearing products and services with a highly personalized and innovative approach, helping customers reconnect to the people and things they love through improved hearing healthcare. Headquartered in Minneapoils, Minnesota, we operate more than 1, 500 locally franchised and corporate-owned retail hearing aid clinics across the United States. The Miracle-Ear brand is owned by Amplifon, the global leader in the retail hearing aid industry, operating in 29 countries world-wide.
company_locations: Larchmont, New York, United States
description: Our franchise partner is looking for motivated individuals with a passion for helping others to contribute to the high level of customer satisfaction that Miracle-Ear is known for. Making a difference in people’s lives is why you chose this career. Our Hearing Care Professionals are industry experts, healthcare advisors, sales consultants, program marketers and product specialists all in one. As our team grows, we’ll invest in you by offering continuous training and development opportunities that empower our employees to become leaders in the industry. Responsibilities: Manage the customer journey through appointment consultation, testing, education, sale, and after-care. Offer personalized customer consultation on hearing solutions that fit their unique needs and lifestyle, while providing a comprehensive overview of hearing aid options. Lead sales of hearing aids and accessories contributing to individual and office revenue goals. Guide customers through device fitting and demonstration while educating them on the importance of hearing health and the long-term effects of hearing loss. Partner with the Front Office Associate to ensure a seamless customer experience, effective schedule management and clinic operations. Ensure data accuracy and privacy by maintaining customer records and ensuring compliance with all protected customer healthcare data. Stay current on industry trends and maintain professional credentials through continuous education and networking. Promote hearing health awareness through community outreach events and partnerships Drive local engagement by supporting marketing initiatives and managing special events. About us:For over 75 years, Miracle-Ear has led the way in innovation and customer service, helping over 50 million people with hearing loss. With 1, 500 franchised and corporately owned retail clinics across the United States, we’ve developed a deep understanding of how to care for customer needs and take pride in improving every customers quality of life. Through the Miracle-Ear Foundation, we give back to the local communities we serve, with a portion of every hearing aid sold helping someone in need. Fostering a culture of belonging allows us to deliver on our promise of helping millions of diverse customers rediscover all the emotions of sound. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If selected for an interview, please advise our Human Resources team if you require accommodation during the interview and assessment process and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.

requirements: Associates degree or equivalent 60 hours of completed coursework; 1+ year training or related experience as a Hearing Aid Specialist; Current knowledge of hearing aid devices and technology; Experience in a customer facing role, dedicated to providing high quality customer service; Confidence, attentiveness, empathy, and critical thinking skills; Computer proficiency in Microsoft Office, Windows, CRM, and POS Systems

We hire individuals from a variety of backgrounds and industries and help them grow from Sales Consultant in Training to Hearing Care Professional through a comprehensive paid training program and apprenticeship. No hearing healthcare experience is required. This is a rewarding, consultative, sales opportunity that has high earning potential, all while making a difference in people’s lives. company_locations: Boonton, New Jersey, United States
description: About Us PTW North America Corporation, a leader in precision dosimetry solutions for the radiotherapy field, is looking for an experienced and driven Sales Representative to join our team. Our advanced hardware and software products are trusted by radiotherapy departments worldwide to ensure patient safety in cancer treatment. As a wholly owned subsidiary of PTW of Freiburg, Germany, with a proud history dating back to 1922, we continue to innovate and lead in radiation measurement technology. Position Overview This position serves the Central Territory, which includes Colorado, Kansas, Montana, Nebraska, New Mexico, North Dakota, Oklahoma, South Dakota, Texas, and Wyoming. Ideally, candidates will reside in Texas, however the prospective candidate may reside within the territory as long as they are close to a major airport. Key Responsibilities Drive sales of high-precision radiotherapy dosimetry hardware and software to Medical Physicists (primarily PhD and MS level) in radiotherapy departments at medical facilities. Cultivate strong customer relationships, maintain an active presence within the territory, and grow sales in a market with immense potential. Manage a sales cycle that ranges from one month to over two years, depending on project scope and client needs. Benefits Competitive base salary with structured, uncapped commission potential. Generous benefits package including medical, dental, and eye care coverage, along with a 401(k) with company matching. Flexible, home-based position requiring 50% travel. Ideal Candidate Qualifications Character: Demonstrated integrity, reliability, honesty, diligence, and a conscientious work ethic. Sales Experience: Proven background in capital medical equipment sales, ideally within radiotherapy dosimetry or related medical fields. Technical Expertise: Proficient in PC usage, Microsoft Office applications (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint), and CRM systems. Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Flexibility and Independence: Able to work independently from home and willing to travel within the territory. Our Team Joining PTW North America means joining a close-knit team of individuals who work collaboratively in a supportive small-business environment. We’re looking for someone who will contribute positively to our culture of teamwork, respect, and innovation. Interested? To apply, please send your resume to Joanna Sifonios, Office Manager, at Joanna. Sifonios@ptwdosimetry. com.

description: Position OverviewWe are excited to welcome a skilled Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM Developer to our dynamic team. In this role, you will play a crucial part in crafting, deploying, and maintaining cutting-edge CRM solutions that streamline business operations and foster growth. You will work collaboratively with various teams to design, analyze, build, and test CRM functionalities. Beyond development, you’ll also address system-related challenges, ensuring business goals are consistently met. Core ResponsibilitiesCRM Solution Development Build, customize, and implement Microsoft Dynamics CRM solutions while ensuring compatibility with existing systems. Create and manage workflows, dashboards, forms, and views, alongside developing both custom and standard reports. Develop web-based applications, APIs, console tools, and Windows services to support CRM functionality. Guarantee that all technical deliverables align with business needs and maintain high-quality standards. Project Coordination and Documentation Contribute to technical solution planning and project discussions. Prepare and maintain essential documentation, including source code details, technical designs, and testing outcomes. Support key project phases such as System Integration Testing (SIT) and User Acceptance Testing (UAT) by resolving issues efficiently. Enhancing Business Processes Identify business challenges and recommend creative CRM solutions to enhance efficiency and profitability. Stay informed on emerging tools, technologies, and best practices to continually improve solutions. QualificationsRequired Skills and Experience Deep knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics 365 CRM, particularly in Customer Service applications. A minimum of three years of hands-on experience with Dynamics 365 CRM and Power BI development. Strong programming skills in ASP. NET C#, JavaScript, HTML5, CSS, and related web technologies. Additional Preferred Skills Previous experience in the shipping industry or similar sectors. Familiarity with Agile and SCRUM frameworks. What We’re Looking ForKey Soft Skills Passion for solving complex business problems through technology. Self-motivated and quick to adapt to new challenges or tools. Collaborative mindset, particularly when working with global or remote teams. Strong verbal and written communication skills in English. A proactive attitude and the ability to manage shifting priorities effectively. Personal CharacteristicsThe ideal candidate thrives in a team-oriented environment, adapts easily to changing requirements, and is dedicated to process improvement and automation. They are dependable, flexible, and eager to take on new learning opportunities. Why Join Us?If you’re passionate about leveraging your skills to create impactful CRM solutions in a fast-paced, supportive team, this role is for you. Apply today and take the next step in your career journey!

You’ll work closely with our Director of Operations and Community Manager to drive awareness, conversion and retention of our user base. Hours: Full-time (9-5PM Monday-Friday). You can also anticipate additional hours (paid) to help support evening and weekend events. Salary: $22/hour + $200/month in Pickle credits!Key Responsibilities Events + ActivationsEvents are a critical aspect to our community growth, and a key element of your role will be supporting the prep and execution of a variety of events. Here’s what you’ll own: Create promotional materials in Canva for event invites + socials Set up event RSVPs on platforms like Partiful and Posh Source attendees through cold-outreach on social media channels, and create email blasts to invite community members Draft pre- and post-event outreach emails Collaborate with the NYC Community Manager on event execution, including: location sourcing, invite creation, set-up + tear-down; Engage with attendees on-site and post-activation Identify ways to amplify events through UGC, word-of-mouth and owned social media Email CreationWe engage with our community a lot via email, sharing inspo for what’s trending, educating users on what to upload now and inviting them to fun events. You’ll help create weekly emails to engage our users. Timely execution of these emails and high attention to detail is key here! Contribute ideas and source pieces to curate emails Manage the creation + execution of multiple emails / week Order Fulfillment & StylingWe’re an early stage startup and are big on interacting directly with our customers. If they’re looking for a rental, we want to make sure they get one! You’ll be a critical part of this: Monitoring order fulfillment rates and conducting outreach to anyone with order issues Provide styling help to people who are looking for a rental, but need some inspo Proactive outreach to our user-base to help them with rentals for special occasions (eg. birthdays) Influencer OutreachCreators love using Pickle, and we love introducing them to our platform! You’ll help us keep this initiative in motion: Conducting weekly outreach to potential influencer partners Help launch new influencer closets on Pickle, including sourcing, uploading and social content creation Ad Hoc Growth Initiatives *these will change based on need, but might include: Assisting with the creation of partnership pitch decks Conducting outreach to top users or top owners Learning Outcomes Being at an early-stage startup is fun! Things move quickly and we’re always testing and learning something new. That means you’ll be able to gain lots of exposure and hands-on experience, while you build your social media know-how and executional capabilities. …plus, you’ll get: Credits to try out our platform and rent the hottest items (!!) An opportunity to contribute directly to a platform that is changing the way people shop, while promoting sustainability and empowermenthere

requirements: Excellent attention to detail with strong organizational skills; Ability to multi-task with excellent follow through and task completion; Problem solver, able to take initiative and work independently to produce quality results; Experience with design platforms (ideally Canva, but experience with Figma or similar is great as well); Experience using GoogleSheets / Excel (we do a lot of tracking across these platforms, so you’ll need to be comfortable with these tools, however extensive formula experience is not required); Passion for fashion; Recent graduate with a Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Business, Customer Success or related field or 1+ years of experience at an early-stage company; Has experience with email marketing platforms (eg. Customer.io, Mailchimp, Brevo, etc); Experience working in marketing (eg. CRM, influencer marketing, digital marketing, social media, etc); Actively part of NYC communities where our target audience spends time (eg. company_description: SWK moves businesses beyond technology. We look at our client's whole business for opportunities to improve systems. We then apply our many years of business solutions knowledge and know-how to tie it all together… seamlessly. SWK offers ERP, EDI and WMS software products and solutions as well as customized software development and managed network services. We help companies that are well positioned for growth but are constrained by software, IT infrastructure, and workflow processes across departmental silos. We can help overcome these challenges. We understand that each of our clients are unique and technology solutions need to fit their individual workflows, not the other way around. This is what our team has a passion for, understanding how you operate then delivering solutions that will take you to new levels of efficiency and success.
company_locations: TELECOMMUTE; New Jersey, United States
description: At SWK Technologies, our commitment to enhancing operational efficiency is central to our mission. We strive to empower businesses through tailored software solutions that address their unique challenges and foster growth. To support our dynamic environment, we are seeking a Manager of Support Services to lead our efforts in delivering exceptional customer support and technical assistance. In this pivotal role, you will oversee the Support Services team, ensuring that clients receive prompt and effective resolutions to their inquiries. Your leadership will be essential in developing strategies to enhance the support experience, improve team performance, and implement best practices in customer service. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background combined with exceptional communication skills, enabling them to bridge the gap between clients and our technical resources. If you are a passionate leader committed to excellence and client satisfaction, we welcome you to join our team.

requirements: Proven experience in a customer support management role, preferably within a technology or software organization.; Strong leadership skills with the ability to motivate and manage a team effectively; Experience with support ticketing systems and customer relationship management (CRM) tools.; Ability to learn new processes quickly and identify areas of improvement.; A client-centric approach, with a focus on service excellence.; Clear, articulate, and concise communications, written and verbal.; 10+ years of experience directly managing a team within a call center or dispatch center.; 10+ years of experience in any technical or engineering IT role, especially at an MSP.; Experience managing a remote team.; Experience with GoTo contact center, ConnectWise Manage, ServiceNow, or Jira.; Proficiency with Microsoft Vizio.
title: CRM Technical Developer

company_description: We are FutureConnectors. Creators. Experience MakersFuture is a global multi-platform media company and leading digital publisher, with scalable brands and diversified revenue streams. We are dedicated to connecting over 300 million people worldwide with their passions, through expert content, world-class events and cutting-edge proprietary technology. We have big ambitions to transform media and change people’s lives. We have a market-leading portfolio of over 220 brands spanning across technology, gaming, TV & entertainment, women’s lifestyle, music, sport, creative and photography, home interest and B2B. You may have heard of us…But a stellar heritage isn’t enough. We continue to grow our portfolio and launch new brands, restlessly looking to improve, innovate and push the boundaries of what can be done. We develop leading-edge technology which is disrupting the media marketplace. Together, we’re exceeding the expectations of everyone we exist for – our audiences, clients, staff and shareholders. In a short space of time, Future has transformed into an innovative global media platform. We reap the rewards too, of course, with a fun and creative place to work with endless opportunities to forge a career. We believe in teamwork that transcends location, so we don’t have a Future HQ but a globally connected workforce across the UK, US, Europe and AustraliaEvery kind of talent is celebrated here. . We hire for person not for the role, looking for people who share our ambitions to be bold and innovate, making Future a global success story.
company_locations: New York, New York, United States
description: Are you a project management / client services expert in the digital media and branded content space who is passionate about delivering the best service and leading teams that do the same? Have you had success working with luxury fashion, jewelry &/or watch clients? Do you enjoy and excel at handling communication across all levels of a client’s organization? Do you have experience working with teams such as Sales, Video, Branded Content, Design/Creative, Edit, Ad Operations and Social to build programs from kick-off through campaign wrap? If so, we want to hear from you. Key Responsibilities: As a Director, Client Success at Future, you are the quarterback in the execution of some of our largest custom and integrated programs. Reporting to the VP US Client Success and Global Ad Operations, you are the client’s main contact after the sale, ensuring their expectations are met throughout the program and delivering white-glove service. You engage with all types of client stakeholders, from execution teams to senior decision makers. Internally, you are building timelines throughout the campaign and working with teams on production of custom offerings, ensuring launches, optimum performance and full delivery. An organized approach to project management will be imperative, balancing client needs and what our teams require to accomplish their respective deliverables. When things don’t progress as planned, you gracefully pivot and collaborate with clients and internal colleagues. You monitor performance throughout programs, recommending optimizations and upsells. Your greatest success is exceeding client expectations, having them renew a program incorporating your recommendations and getting to work with them again! You join a small group of other Directors, each managing teams of Client Success Managers, ensuring your team hits all their marks to do the same. Experience that will put you ahead of the curve. .. 6+ years experience in project management/account management, preferably in digital media Experience managing people / teams Excellent client service communication skills via email, presentation, and both virtual and in-person meetings Proficiency in CRM and project management tools such as Salesforce, Asana Experience working with luxury fashion, jewelry &/or watch clients is desired Experience in post-sale digital campaign execution Experience working with native content creation What's in it for youThe expected salary range for this role is $115, 000 - $135, 000This is a Hybrid role from our New York Office, working three days from the office, two from home… Plus more great benefits, which include; Uncapped leave, because we trust you to manage your workload and time When we hit our targets, enjoy a share of our profits with a bonus Refer a friend and get rewarded when they join Future Wellbeing support with access to our Colleague Assistant Programmes Opportunity to purchase shares in Future, with our Share Incentive Plan Internal job family level C4Who are we…We’re Future, the global leader in specialist media. With over 3, 000 employees working across 200+ media brands, Future is a prime destination for passionate people worldwide looking to consume trusted, expert content that educates and inspires action - both online and off - through our specialist websites, magazines, events, newsletters, podcasts and social spaces. We’ve got ambitious plans that further build on our growth momentum and unlock new opportunities – and we’re looking for driven people who want to be a part of it!Our Future, Our Responsibility - Inclusion and Diversity at FutureWe embrace and celebrate diversity, making it part of who we are. Different perspectives spark ideas, fuel creativity, and push us to innovate. That’s why we’re building a workplace where everyone feels valued, respected, and empowered to thrive. When it comes to hiring, we keep it fair and inclusive, welcoming talent from every walk of life. It’s not just about what you bring to the table — it’s about making sure the table has room for everyone. Because a diverse team isn’t just good for business. It’s the Future. Find out more about Our Future, Our Responsibility on our website. Please let us know if you need any reasonable adjustments made so we can give you the best experience!#LI-Hybrid

company_description: For more than 75 years, Miracle-Ear has been an industry leader, helping over 50 million people with hearing loss. We offer hearing products and services with a highly personalized and innovative approach, helping customers reconnect to the people and things they love through improved hearing healthcare. Headquartered in Minneapoils, Minnesota, we operate more than 1, 500 locally franchised and corporate-owned retail hearing aid clinics across the United States. The Miracle-Ear brand is owned by Amplifon, the global leader in the retail hearing aid industry, operating in 29 countries world-wide.
company_locations: Larchmont, New York, United States
description: Our franchise partner is looking for motivated individuals with a passion for helping others to contribute to the high level of customer satisfaction that Miracle-Ear is known for. Making a difference in people’s lives is why you chose this career. Our Hearing Care Professionals are industry experts, healthcare advisors, sales consultants, program marketers and product specialists all in one. As our team grows, we’ll invest in you by offering continuous training and development opportunities that empower our employees to become leaders in the industry. Responsibilities: Manage the customer journey through appointment consultation, testing, education, sale, and after-care. Offer personalized customer consultation on hearing solutions that fit their unique needs and lifestyle, while providing a comprehensive overview of hearing aid options. Lead sales of hearing aids and accessories contributing to individual and office revenue goals. Guide customers through device fitting and demonstration while educating them on the importance of hearing health and the long-term effects of hearing loss. Partner with the Front Office Associate to ensure a seamless customer experience, effective schedule management and clinic operations. Ensure data accuracy and privacy by maintaining customer records and ensuring compliance with all protected customer healthcare data. Stay current on industry trends and maintain professional credentials through continuous education and networking. Promote hearing health awareness through community outreach events and partnerships Drive local engagement by supporting marketing initiatives and managing special events. About us:For over 75 years, Miracle-Ear has led the way in innovation and customer service, helping over 50 million people with hearing loss. With 1, 500 franchised and corporately owned retail clinics across the United States, we’ve developed a deep understanding of how to care for customer needs and take pride in improving every customers quality of life. Through the Miracle-Ear Foundation, we give back to the local communities we serve, with a portion of every hearing aid sold helping someone in need. Fostering a culture of belonging allows us to deliver on our promise of helping millions of diverse customers rediscover all the emotions of sound. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. If selected for an interview, please advise our Human Resources team if you require accommodation during the interview and assessment process and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs.
excerpt: Our franchise partner is looking for motivated individuals with a passion for helping others to contribute to the high level of customer satisfaction that Miracle-Ear is known for. Making a difference in people’s lives is why you chose this career.Our ...
requirements: Associates degree or equivalent 60 hours of completed coursework; 1+ year training or related experience as a Hearing Aid Specialist; Current knowledge of hearing aid devices and technology; Experience in a customer facing role, dedicated to providing high quality customer service; Confidence, attentiveness, empathy, and critical thinking skills; Computer proficiency in Microsoft Office, Windows, CRM, and POS Systems

company_description: For more than 75 years, Miracle-Ear has been an industry leader, helping over 50 million people with hearing loss. We offer hearing products and services with a highly personalized and innovative approach, helping customers reconnect to the people and things they love through improved hearing healthcare. Headquartered in Minneapoils, Minnesota, we operate more than 1, 500 locally franchised and corporate-owned retail hearing aid clinics across the United States.
